failures.title: Ignition and Fuel System Issue
failures.suggestSolution: Regularly inspect and replace spark plugs and ignition components; ensure proper fuel system maintenance.

failures.title: Engine Misfire and Exhaust Leak
failures.suggestSolution: Immediately address engine misfires and rich fuel conditions; repair any exhaust leaks to protect the catalytic converter.

failures.title: Wheel Sensor or Wiring Damage
failures.suggestSolution: Secure wiring harnesses properly; promptly replace damaged wheel speed sensors or wiring, and address bearing issues.

failures.title: Brake System Malfunction
failures.suggestSolution: Do not ignore ABS or brake warning lights; seek immediate professional inspection for any braking system malfunctions.

failures.title: Airbag Wiring Safety
failures.suggestSolution: Ensure all airbag system wiring connectors are secure; avoid physical damage to components and follow all safety protocols.

failures.title: Oil Change and Pressure Warning
failures.suggestSolution: Adhere to oil change schedules and use the correct oil type/viscosity; promptly address low oil pressure warnings.

failures.title: Battery or Communication Fault
failures.suggestSolution: Maintain a healthy vehicle battery and charging system; get persistent communication fault codes professionally diagnosed.

failures.title: Electrical System Failure
failures.suggestSolution: Ensure all aftermarket electrical installations are professional; maintain overall electrical system health to prevent module communication failures.

badPractices.descriptionBadPractice: Ignoring routine spark plug replacement, neglecting ignition coil or wire wear, or poor fuel system maintenance (e.g., old fuel filter, faulty fuel pump).
Neglecting engine misfires, running with rich fuel mixtures, or ignoring exhaust leaks, which all contribute to premature catalytic converter failure.
Not securing wiring harnesses, allowing physical damage to wheel speed sensor wiring, or ignoring signs of a damaged wheel bearing (which can affect the reluctor ring).
Driving with persistent ABS/brake system warning lights, ignoring intermittent brake system malfunctions, or exposing the ABS module/wiring to excessive moisture or physical impact.
Improperly reconnecting wiring connectors under seats after maintenance or cleaning, physical damage to airbag wiring, or incorrectly replacing airbag system components.
Ignoring persistent low oil pressure warnings, using incorrect oil viscosity, or neglecting oil changes which can lead to sensor fouling or failure due to sludge buildup.
Ignoring battery and charging system issues (low voltage), improper electrical repairs leading to poor connections or damaged wiring, or not addressing other related communication fault codes.

Exposing vehicle wiring to damage (e.g., during aftermarket installations), neglecting battery issues that cause low voltage to modules, or ignoring signs of module malfunction like power window or door lock failures.

odbErrors.errorTitle: Left Front Wheel Speed Sensor Circuit
Brake Control Relay Contact Circuit Open
Right Front Passenger Airbag Deploy Circuit
Lost Communication with Engine Control Module (ECM/PCM)
Lost Communication with Body Control Module (BCM)

technicalErrors.suggestion: Check the speed sensor in the transmission. It may require replacement if damaged.
Check the oil level and pressure sensor. Do not continue driving if the problem persists. Take the vehicle to a workshop immediately.
Check the engine thermostat. If itâ€™s stuck open, it needs to be replaced.
Check the fuel tank float or sensor. It could be stuck.
